articles.content:
Over 180 espionage flights 
    Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The U.S. warmongers  committed over 180 cases of aerial espionage against the DPRK in January, according to military sources.
   Involved in them were strategic and tactical reconnaissance planes of various types, including strategic reconnaissance planes "U-2" and "RC-135", tactical reconnaissance planes "RC-12" and "RF-4c", an electronic warfare helicopter "EH-60", a patrol plane "P-3" and early-warning plane "E-3".    
   These planes made sorties from their bases in Japan and abroad. Flying over the area along the Military Demarcation Line and over the east and west coasts of Korea, including Chunchon, Yangyang and Kanghwa island, the planes carried out aerial photographing and electronic reconnaissances of the objects along the frontline and in coastal areas and the depth of the DPRK.

articles.title: Cave-in of subway under construction in South Korea
articles.content:
Cave-in of subway under construction in South Korea 
    Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- A cave-in took place at a subway construction site in Taegu on January 22, a radio report from Seoul said.
   On the early morning of the day a passing bus fell down 30 metres by the cave-in, leaving some of the passengers dead.
   Before the accident taxi drivers informed the subway management side seven times that the ground of the construction site would fall down, but the management side and the city authorities turned a deaf ear to the warnings, said the radio.    
   The radio noted the accident proved the authorities incapable of providing against the accident, which is a "joint work" between the South Korean authorities and the business side.
